Release information :
TouchGFX Generator V4.21.1
New Features:
Bugfixes:
Improvements:

ThirdParty.Name: X-CUBE-TOUCHGFX
ThirdParty.ShortDescription: TouchGFX Generator

Note.Release:
Release version : 4.21.0
Release information :
TouchGFX Generator V4.21.0
New Features: - Vector Rendering: Added support for Software and Hardware (GPU2D) Vector Rendering.
Bugfixes: - GPU2D (NeoChrom) interrupt priority lowered. Applications using FreeRTOS with GPU2D would have issues because SysTick interrupt was lower than GPU2D. - Missing driver includes for BW, Grey2 and Grey4 pixelformats are added in TouchGFXConfiguration.cpp file when selected.
Improvements: - Data Reader Interface: Allow user to specify the base address and the size of external non memory mapped memory. - GPU2D (NeoChrom) Command List Size and Memory Pool Location can now be configured. - Video: Added support for ARGB8888 (32-bit) Video Buffer for Software Decoding. - TouchGFX Core now handles DCache maintenance on Cortex-M7.

ThirdParty.Name: X-CUBE-TOUCHGFX
ThirdParty.ShortDescription: TouchGFX Generator

Note.Release:
Release version : 4.20.0
Release information :
New Features:
- Rendering of Canvas widgets in TouchGFX is now supported by DMA2D (ChromART) through new painter functions for RGB565 and RGB888. - Users can now configure GPIOs through CubeMX to measure the performance of their applications based on TouchGFX Events such as "Render Time", "Frame rate", "VSYNC". Read the HAL Development scenario at http://support.touchgfx.com.
Bugfixes:
- GPU2D (NeoChrom) in TouchGFX is currently only supported by ThreadX RTOS. For devices that support GPU2D, users were allowed to select other operating systems than ThreadX which would lead to compilation errors.

ThirdParty.Name: X-CUBE-TOUCHGFX
ThirdParty.ShortDescription: TouchGFX Generator

Note.Release:
Release version : 4.19.1
Release information :
TouchGFX Generator V4.19.1
New Features:
Bugfixes: - Video: Some abitrary video frame dimensions were decoded wrong when using Hardware decodeding. - The function MX_TouchGFX_PreOSInit(void) was not properly generated for all RTOS.
Improvements: - Video: Double buffer video controller starts decoding video frames sooner.

ThirdParty.Name: X-CUBE-TOUCHGFX
ThirdParty.ShortDescription: TouchGFX Generator

Note.Release:
Release version : 4.19.0
Release information :
TouchGFX Generator V4.19.0
New Features: - Native ThreadX Middleware support for U5 devices. - GPU2D can now be enabled as a graphics accelerator for MCUs that support it (.e.g. STM32U599)
Bugfixes: - Generator now handles DCache correctly on Cortex-M7.
Improvements: - Virtual functions HAL::beginFrame() and HAL::endFrame() are now defined in TouchGFXHAL.cpp. - Video: DMA2D is utilized to copy YCbCr video data to RGB video buffer(s) for MCUs that support it (.e.g. STM32H750)

ThirdParty.Name: X-CUBE-TOUCHGFX
ThirdParty.ShortDescription: TouchGFX Generator

Note.Release:
Release version : 4.18.1
Release information :
TouchGFX Generator V4.18.1
New Features:
Bugfixes: - Video: Concurrent video streams were not syncronized properly. - Video: Video files containing empty frames were not handled properly by both Software- and Hardware decoder. - Video: MDK-ARM compilation would fail on tgfx_jpeg_utils.c.
Improvements: - Video: Ability to mix video buffer and framebuffer pixelformats for Software decoder., e.g. RGB565 video buffer on RGB888 framebuffer. - Video: RGB buffer can be placed in external memory, previously defaulted to internal. - Video: Decoders no longer Busy-Wait while waiting to finish decoding a single frame.

ThirdParty.Name: X-CUBE-TOUCHGFX
ThirdParty.ShortDescription: TouchGFX Generator

Note.Release:
Release version : 4.18.0
Release information :
TouchGFX Generator V4.18.0
New Features: - Support for XRGB8888 (32-bit) framebuffer color format - Replaced use of NoDMA class with generated class - Video: Added support for Software and Hardware MJPEG decoding
Bugfixes: - Prevention of DMA class to change context when loading L8 clut
Improvements: - 16bpp DMA class now recieves 24-bit color for more accurate color to DMA - Generated code headers now specifies which files are to be modified by user

ThirdParty.Name: X-CUBE-TOUCHGFX
ThirdParty.ShortDescription: TouchGFX Generator

Note.Release:
Release version : 4.17.0
Release information :
TouchGFX Generator V4.17.0
New Features: - Support for dual-core MCUs (H747, H745) - Support for ThreadX (depends on X-CUBE-AZRTOS-H7 pack) - Relevant functions now use OSWrappers::taskYield() if RTOS is used - Support for ARGB8888 (32-bit) framebuffer color format - Support for FMC display interface
Improvements: - Renamed Framebuffer Pixel Formats to be more in line with TouchGFX LCD classes ("Black White" => "BW", "Grey" => "Gray") - Support for new Blit Operations (BLIT_OP_COPY_L8, BLIT_OP_COPY_16BIT, BLIT_OP_FILL_16BIT) which simplify generated DMA2D code (STM32DMA.cpp) - Applications that mix image color formats and frame buffer color formats (e.g. RGB888 images on RGB565) now have improved DMA2D support
Bugfixes: - Disabling OS on H7 no longer causes an error. - Disabling dcache on M7 would fail. A run-time check is now done before clear/flush/invalidate dcache. - Fixed issue where re-genereating code in CubeMX from a G0 AT would cause SerialDataReader to not work properly

ThirdParty.Name: X-CUBE-TOUCHGFX
ThirdParty.ShortDescription: TouchGFX Generator

Note.Release:
Release version : 4.16.1
Release information :
TouchGFX Generator V4.16.1
Bugfixes: - The function to enter the TouchGFX main event loop was not called when choosing "custom" RTOS.

ThirdParty.Name: X-CUBE-TOUCHGFX
ThirdParty.ShortDescription: TouchGFX Generator

Note.Release:
Release version : 4.16.0
Release information :
TouchGFX Generator V4.16.0
New Features: - When selecting L8 for LTDC pixel format TouchGFX Generator will create a CLUT and load it into the LTDC at touchgfx::TouchGFXHAL::initialize(). - Optimized touchgfx driver for DMA2D when configuring blit operations. - New state machine to handle DCache invalidation only when necessary.
Bugfixes: - TouchGFX Generator was previously available for projects with dual Core MCUs H747* and H745* despite not being supported yet. - Correctly generating function name for "touchgfxDisplayDriverTransmitBlock". - Added missing implementation of OSWrappers::signalRenderingDone() for CMSIS V1, CMSIS V2, and Custom. - DataReader defaults to 250 bytes before invoking a DMA transfer. - startFlashLineRead, uses DMA to force parallel work.

ThirdParty.Name: X-CUBE-TOUCHGFX
ThirdParty.ShortDescription: TouchGFX Generator

Note.Release:
Release version : 4.15.0
Release information :
TouchGFX Generator V4.15.0 - This version is compatible with STM32CubeMX V6.0.0 and TouchGFX Designer V4.15.0
New Features: - Data Reader interface for retrieving data from a non-memory-mapped flash - Cortex-M33 support - Improved Partial Framebuffer strategy - touchgfx_taskEntry() now uses OSWrappers::isVSyncAvailable() in case of No-OS

ThirdParty.Name: X-CUBE-TOUCHGFX
ThirdParty.ShortDescription: TouchGFX Generator

Note.Release:
Release version : 4.14.0
Release information :
TouchGFX Generator V4.14.0 - This version is compatible with STM32CubeMX V6.0.0 and TouchGFX Designer V4.14.0
New Features: - Project updater for STM32CubeIDE adds -femit-class-debug-always flag to compilation to allow for debugging UI components. - HAL::blockCopy(void* RESTRICT dest, const void* RESTRICT src, uint32_t numBytes) is now exposed through TouchGFXHAL interface. - OSWrapper CMSISv1 and CMSISv2 no longer require FreeRTOS middleware to be enabled; this allows usage of any CMSIS compatible RTOS. - Project updater now supports ARMCLANG.
Bugfixes: - Fixed missing extern functions for Partial Framebuffer Strategy. - Project updater now correctly updates STM32CubeIDE projects - Fixed potential lock up when using CMSISv2 driver.

ThirdParty.Name: X-CUBE-TOUCHGFX
ThirdParty.ShortDescription: TouchGFX Generator

Note.Release:
Release version : 4.13.0
Release information :

ThirdParty.Name: X-CUBE-DISPLAY
ThirdParty.ShortDescription: Expansion Pack for display modules

Note.Release:
Release version : 3.0.0 Release date : 2023-01-18
Release information : - This version is compatible with STM32CubeMX V6.7.0 New Features: - Added support for Cortex-M7 devices - Added LCD Utilities to support displaying transparent Texts - Added GFX01M2_Custom Application example for the NUCLEO-WB55RG board - Added GFX02Z1_Custom Application example for the NUCLEO-U575ZI board - Added GFX01M2_FlashLoader Application example for the NUCLEO-WB55RG board - Added GFX02Z1_FlashLoader Application example for the NUCLEO-L4R5ZI board - Added GFX02Z1_FlashLoader Application example for the NUCLEO-U575ZI board - Added GFX02Z1_HelloWorld Application example for the NUCLEO-H723ZG board - Added GFX02Z1_FlashLoader Application example for the NUCLEO-H723ZG board - Removed deprecated functions
Bugfixes: - Fixed issue with generated mem_io code when using DMA - Fixed issues with Custom LCD and external memory interfaces
Improvements: - Updated ILI9341 LCD Drivers - Updated ST7789V LCD Drivers - Updated MX25L6433F External Memory Drivers - Enhanced HelloWorld Examples - Allow displaying transparent text for the Boards information, the example’s Hints and the Copyrights - Implemented rendering/display queue to allow parallel rendering and display SPI transfers - Updated STM32WBxx_HAL_Drivers to v1.11.0 - Allow using DMA for external OctoSPI memories - Rework DMA support for new devices - Enable QSPI Bus Type for Custom Memory interface - oswrapper: remove extra include to HAL header files for NoOS template - mem_io: add flash page and block size defines
Pack Restrictions : - Restricted to processor vendor: STMicroelectronics:13

ThirdParty.Name: X-CUBE-DISPLAY
ThirdParty.ShortDescription: Expansion Pack for display modules

Note.Release:
Release version : 2.2.0 Release date : 2022-05-02
Release information : - This version is compatible with STM32CubeMX V6.5.0 New Features: - Added Support for Custom LCD Controllers - Added Support for Custom External Memory Controllers - Generated PDF and CHM API Documentation
Bugfixes: - Fix Issue with undefined BRR for non supported series F7 and H7 - Disable the SW pack when TrustZone is enabled
Improvements: - Disable the SW pack for non-supported STM32 Families - STM32CubeIDE: add debug launcher files
Pack Restrictions : - Restricted to processor vendor: STMicroelectronics:13

ThirdParty.Name: X-CUBE-DISPLAY
ThirdParty.ShortDescription: Expansion Pack for display modules

Note.Release:
Release version : 2.1.0 Release date : 2022-04-08
Release information : - This version is compatible with STM32CubeMX V6.5.0 New Features: - Support Real Time Operating systems: FreeRTOS and ThreadX Native Middleware - Support HW Timers for TE Event and line counting - Support disabling TE Events - Support Little and Big ENDIANS - Support swap of Red and Blue components
Bugfixes: - Deprecated API BSP_MEM_GetTransfertStatus() and renamed to BSP_MEM_GetTransferStatus() - Deprecated API BSP_MEM_SignalTransfertDone() and renamed to BSP_MEM_SignalTransferDone() - Deprecated API BSP_LCD_GetTransfertStatus() and renamed to BSP_LCD_GetTransferStatus() - Deprecated API BSP_LCD_SignalTransfertDone() and renamed to BSP_LCD_SignalTransferDone() - Fixed Dependencies for Board Part - Fixed destination folder to be always DISPLAY - Clean-up header file include for BSP Drivers - External Loaders : Fixed issue with STM32CubeIDE not able to load external loaders
Improvements: - Support Linked list GPDMA requests for FMC LCD Controllers - Release LCD/MEM locks before notifying upper levels - MEM: Exported size of external Flash memory - LCD: Set default Vsync Frequency to 60 Hz - Disable DMA parameter for OCTOSPI external memories - ExternalLoaders : Added MX25L6433F_GFX01M2_STM32L4.stldr
Pack Restrictions : - Restricted to processor vendor: STMicroelectronics:13

ThirdParty.Name: X-CUBE-DISPLAY
ThirdParty.ShortDescription: Expansion Pack for display modules

Note.Release:
Release version : 2.0.1 Release date : 2021-12-13
Release information :
- This version is compatible with STM32CubeMX V6.4.0 - Support TE Modes 1 and 2 - Updated template files for SPI, FMC and OCTOSPI - Updated CMSIS Drivers - Updated HAL Drivers - Bug fixes - Fix line counting on TE events - Fix reading device id issue for the X-NUCLEO-GFX01M2 expansion board - Check for operation status before calling apis - Add PACK_SELF_CONTEXTUALIZATION keyword - Return Error when DMA was not configured by user for BSP SPI - NUCLEO-WB55RG - HelloWorld Example : Update system clock to 64MHz
Pack Restrictions : - Restricted to processor vendor: STMicroelectronics:13

ThirdParty.Name: X-CUBE-DISPLAY
ThirdParty.ShortDescription: Expansion Pack for display modules

Note.Release:
Release version : 2.0.0 Release date : 2021-10-20
Release information :
- This version is compatible with STM32CubeMX V6.3.0 - Add GFX01M2_HelloWorld Application example for the NUCLEO-WB55RG board - Add GFX01M2_HelloWorld Application example for the NUCLEO-G071RB board - Add GFX02Z1_HelloWorld Application example for the NUCLEO-U575ZI board - Add GFX02Z1_HelloWorld Application example for the NUCLEO-L4R5ZI board - Add GFX01M1_HelloWorld Application example for the NUCLEO-L476RG board - Add support for X-NUCLEO-GFX02Z1 Expansion board - Add support for X-NUCLEO-GFX01M2 Expansion board - Add new MX25L6433F driver for Quad SPI memory - Add new ST7789V LCD Driver - Updated ILI9341V LCD Driver - Add support DMA/GPDMA for both LCD and MEM Drivers - Add support for OctoSPI bus fused for external memory devices - Add support for FMC display interface - Enhanced Display Generator UI to support new LCD and MEM Drivers - Add support for cortex-M33 core - Add support for cortex-M4 core

ThirdParty.Name: X-CUBE-AI
ThirdParty.ShortDescription: Artificial Intelligence

Note.Release:
Release version : 8.0.0
Release information :
Artificial Intelligence Pack version 8.0.0 for STM32 Cortex M7, M4, M0 and M33 MCUs What's new in this release: - ONNX toolbox - add support for quantized ONNX models, Tensor-oriented (QDQ) file format - Input and Output of quantized ONNX models can stay in integer - add support to report the requested runtime memory size (analyze/generate commands) - implement MCUNetV2 RAM optimization techniques - H dimension - TensorFlow 2.11 and Keras.io 2.11 - updated Tensorflow Lite for Micro (2023-01-06 snapshot) - ONNX Runtime 1.13.1 - Align with CMSIS 5.9

ThirdParty.Name: X-CUBE-AI
ThirdParty.ShortDescription: Artificial Intelligence

Note.Release:
Release version : 7.3.0
Release information :
Artificial Intelligence Pack version 7.3.0 for STM32 Cortex M7, M4, M0 and M33 MCUs What's new in this release: - add option to select different objective of optimizations - code size improvement for some kernels - TensorFlow 2.10 and Keras.io 2.10 - upgrade the TensorFlow lite for microcontroller runtime with latest snapshot close to TensorFlow 2.10

ThirdParty.Name: X-CUBE-AI
ThirdParty.ShortDescription: Artificial Intelligence

Note.Release:
Release version : 7.2.0
Release information :
Artificial Intelligence Pack version 7.2.0 for STM32 Cortex M7, M4, M0 and M33 MCUs What's new in this release: - add the main ONNX-ML operators - Support of Cortex M0 devices - bug fixes

ThirdParty.Name: X-CUBE-AI
ThirdParty.ShortDescription: Artificial Intelligence

Note.Release:
Release version : 7.1.0
Release information :
Artificial Intelligence Pack version 7.1.0 for STM32 Cortex M7, M4, M0 and M33 MCUs What's new in this release: - add the main ONNX-ML operators - Support of Cortex M0 devices - bug fixes

ThirdParty.Name: X-CUBE-AI
ThirdParty.ShortDescription: Artificial Intelligence

Note.Release:
Release version : 7.0.0
Release information :
Artificial Intelligence Pack version 7.0.0 for STM32 Cortex M7, M4 and M33 MCUs What's new in this release: - add the main ONNX-ML operators (iForest, OCSVM, k-means..) - upgrade TensorFlow lite runtime 2.5.0 - add support to run locally a generated c-model - improve precision for the quantized models with the scale factor close to zero - UI - enhance STM32 development board setting for best performance - Embedded documentation - new HowTo, complete the FAQ, comparison TFLM and X-CUBE-AI - bug fixes

ThirdParty.Name: X-CUBE-AI
ThirdParty.ShortDescription: Artificial Intelligence

Note.Release:
Release version : 6.0.0
Release information :
Artificial Intelligence Pack version 6.0.0 for STM32 Cortex M7, M4 and M33 MCUs What's new in this release: - add support of code generation with TensorFlow Lite Micro runtime - new operators: ONNX 20+, TFLite 20+, KERAS Lambda/Custom - remove Qmn format support - remove Lasagne/Caffee and ConvNetJs support - add panel for external weight placement - enhance dual core (multiple context support) code generation with MX6.1

ThirdParty.Name: X-CUBE-AI
ThirdParty.ShortDescription: Artificial Intelligence

Note.Release:
Release version : 5.2.0
Release information :
Artificial Intelligence Pack version 5.2.0 for STM32 Cortex M7, M4 and M33 MCUs What's new in this release: added support for relocatable binary model TFLite and Keras importers are now fully based on TensorFlow 2.3 up-to Keras version 2.4.0 model can be imported allow allocation of output buffers in activations buffer

ThirdParty.Name: X-CUBE-AI
ThirdParty.ShortDescription: Artificial Intelligence

Note.Release:
Release version : 5.1.2
Release information :
Artificial Intelligence Pack version 5.1.2 for STM32 Cortex M7 and M4 MCUs What's new in this release: Enhancements of the User Interface New graph to display the C-graph (operators and associated tensors) New graph to display the usage of the activations buffer
C-Code generation Adding support to generate a c-array by weight/bias tensors Adding textual c-graph description (operators and associated tensors) in the reports
Embedded inference client API extension Adding platform observer API
Validation Adding support for int8/uint8 validation files

ThirdParty.Name: X-CUBE-AI
ThirdParty.ShortDescription: Artificial Intelligence

Note.Release:
Release version : 5.0.0
Release information :
Artificial Intelligence Pack version 5.0.0 for STM32 Cortex M7 and M4 MCUs What's new in this release: Support of ONNX

ThirdParty.ShortDescription: Artificial Intelligence

Note.Release:
Release version : 4.1.0
Release information :
Artificial Intelligence Pack version 4.1.0 for STM32 Cortex M7 and M4 MCUs What's new in this release: Support of TensorFlow Lite in integer arithmetic Support of external Flash and Ram

ThirdParty.Name: X-CUBE-AI
ThirdParty.ShortDescription: Artificial Intelligence

Note.Release:
Release version : 4.0.0
Release information :
Artificial Intelligence Pack version 4.0.0 for STM32 Cortex M7 and M4 MCUs What's new in this release: Support of TensorFlow Lite in floating point Support of Keras network quantization Enhancements of the User Interface One click automated validation project build and run on the target New graph display New Logging window with cancel support that will give the results so far New command line interface allowing to perform the following actions on a neural network analyze to give complexity, needed Flash and Ram size generate the C code validate on the desktop and on the target quantize using the min/max or greedy algorithm
